text:
- The TechU program has
been growing really rapidly
over the past couple of years.

I was part of the third
cohort in the United States
to go through the program.

So we were a group of 30
recent college graduates.
- TechU is structured in a way

that the first six months is
a classroom-based training

where we receive training
from technical instructors
and trainers.
- And it's basically sprint work learning,

so it's very similar to
being back in college.
- For example, we had different sprints

for big data, machine
learning, web applications,
and we were able to collaborate

with other solutions architects
and other new graduates

to actually come up with
projects or proof of concepts.

- I'm really proud of the
moment where I had a project
that I felt was needed in the company.
I wrote up this narrative, this document,

and it got sent up the
chain to leadership,

and it's now an actual tool
that we use internally.
So that's a really cool thing to have done
as a graduate in early stage career.

- It was great because I got
to learn not only about AWS,
but also how we as solutions architects
work with customers in the field,
how we do whiteboarding meetings,
how we build POCs,
and how we have customer conversations.
- At first, it can be a bit scary
because you're around like a lot of people
that know a lot of things.
And slowly but surely,
you realize that you are one of the people
that know a lot of things too.
- So when you come out of TechU,

you're what's called an
associate solutions architect.
So you come in as an entry level employee
and then you're placed with the team,
usually the entry level team.

So you're handling some
maybe lower level engagements
with customers.
And then as you continue to grow

and kind of demonstrate an
affinity for one area or another,

you kind of can point that
into different directions.

- So it's a great way to
start your career in AWS

because I think it's such
a comprehensive program
to develop skills.

- Some folks might not have
any cloud experience at all,
so TechU as a program

will also teach you the
fundamentals of AWS Cloud.
- I chose the program because I knew

that six months of training
would be really helpful

for a role that I wasn't
super familiar with.

- I actually had no clue what
the job was when I joined,
but I knew AWS was an interesting place
and was excited about the challenge.
So yeah, now here I am.
(soft electronic music)
